heroIntro: Discover this prestigious 4-bedroom villa situated in the exclusive enclave of Maryvilla, Calpe—a destination favored by discerning international buyers seeking sophisticated Mediterranean living. Reference N6827 represents a rare opportunity to acquire a premium specification property at exceptional value: €1,690,000 for 489m² of meticulously designed space, positioning this villa 20% below comparable properties in neighboring Jávea while maintaining the highest standards of construction and finish. Set on a generous 770m² plot, this residence exemplifies the refined aesthetic and quality craftsmanship that define the luxury property market on the Costa Blanca. The villa's contemporary design, coupled with its strategic location in one of Spain's most prestigious coastal towns, offers the perfect balance between privacy and proximity to world-class amenities. With five bathrooms and expansive living areas, this property caters to the refined tastes of buyers who demand nothing less than exceptional quality and exclusive living. The Costa Blanca's real estate market has demonstrated consistent growth at 7% year-on-year, making this an astute investment alongside a distinguished residential experience.
areaSection: Calpe, perched on the Costa Blanca's most dramatic coastline, captivates visitors with its iconic Peñón de Ifach rock formation rising majestically from crystalline Mediterranean waters. This distinguished town blends authentic Spanish character with cosmopolitan sophistication, positioned between the resort developments of Benidorm and the exclusive enclaves of Jávea. The microclimate here is exceptional—approximately 320 days of sunshine annually, with mild winters and warm summers tempered by refreshing sea breezes. Calpe's geography provides natural protection with Ifach as a stunning backdrop, while the town's elevation on surrounding hills ensures panoramic vistas across the Mediterranean. The combination of pristine beaches, cultural heritage, and modern infrastructure has established Calpe as a premier destination for European property investors and lifestyle seekers. Its transformation from a fishing village to a sophisticated coastal community has preserved authentic charm while introducing world-class amenities.
lifestyleSection: Living in Calpe means embracing a lifestyle where Mediterranean elegance meets cosmopolitan comfort. The established expat community—notably British and German residents—has created a sophisticated social fabric with international restaurants, cultural events, and English-speaking services throughout the town. Your days unfold between world-class beaches like Arenal-Bol, awarded the prestigious Blue Flag certification, and gourmet dining establishments overlooking the sea. The weekly markets offer fresh Mediterranean produce alongside international groceries at supermarkets including Mercadona and Mas y Mas. Healthcare is readily accessible through Centro de Salud Calp and private clinics staffed with English-speaking professionals, while the incoming tram system will revolutionize local connectivity. Golf enthusiasts enjoy Club de Golf Ifach just five minutes away, part of a distinguished circuit including Don Cayo and La Sella. The town's leisurely pace—perfect for morning beach walks and sunset aperitivos—combines with excellent infrastructure, making Calpe an ideal base for both permanent residence and luxury second-home ownership.
investmentSection: This villa represents a compelling investment within a strengthening market. The Costa Blanca's real estate sector has appreciated 7% year-on-year, with Calpe positioned at the premium end of this growth trajectory. At €3,456/m², this property commands a 33% premium over Calpe's €2,600/m² average, justifying superior specifications and location—yet remains strategically priced 20% below comparable Jávea properties, offering sophisticated buyers exceptional value. Rental potential is substantial: similar properties achieve €1,000+ per week during peak seasons, generating annual yields of 8-12% for investors seeking income-producing assets. The villa's four bedrooms and premium finishes position it within the luxury short-term rental market, appealing to discerning travelers willing to pay premium rates. The incoming tram system and continued infrastructure development will enhance property values further. Calpe's status as an established expat destination ensures consistent international demand, whether for personal use or investment appreciation.
conclusion: This exceptional villa in prestigious Maryvilla represents a rare opportunity to acquire premium Mediterranean living at strategically advantageous pricing. The combination of superior construction specifications, four generous bedrooms with five bathrooms, substantial plot space, and Calpe's established position as a sophisticated expat destination creates a compelling case for both owner-occupiers and investment-focused buyers. The property's location—proximate to Blue Flag beaches, world-class amenities, and international schools—coupled with proven 7% annual market appreciation and strong rental income potential, positions it as an astute acquisition within the luxury Costa Blanca segment. lifeAndAmenities.intro: Calpe combines Mediterranean tranquility with comprehensive modern amenities. Whether your priority is healthcare, education, or daily conveniences, this sophisticated coastal town delivers world-class services. The established expat infrastructure means English-speaking professionals and familiar services are readily accessible, ensuring seamless daily living for international residents.

healthcare.text: Healthcare in Calpe meets international standards with multiple options serving the substantial expatriate community. Centro de Salud Calp provides primary care and emergency services within minutes, while private clinics throughout the town employ English-speaking doctors specializing in everything from routine check-ups to specialist consultations. Hospital de Dénia, situated 30 minutes south, is the region's leading private facility with comprehensive emergency and surgical departments. Residents appreciate the accessibility of medical services without compromising quality or language comprehension—critical for permanent or semi-permanent residents. Prescription medications, dental care, and specialist referrals are efficiently managed through the dual public-private healthcare system.

education.text: International education options cater to families seeking British curriculum and expatriate-focused schooling. Lady Elizabeth School in nearby Cumbre del Sol, just 10 minutes away, provides primary and secondary education within a familiar international framework, attracting families from across northern Europe. Laude Newton College, positioned 35 minutes south, offers comprehensive international education through university level. Both institutions serve the substantial British and northern European expat community, ensuring children can continue their educational trajectory without disruption. Day schools, English tutoring, and online educational support are readily available for younger learners.

shopping.text: Calpe's shopping infrastructure seamlessly blends Spanish market culture with international retail convenience. Mercadona, Consum, and Lidl provide everyday groceries and household essentials with competitive pricing typical of Spanish supermarkets. Mas y Mas caters to international preferences with specialty foods and imported products frequented by the British and German expat communities. The weekly market in Calpe town center offers fresh Mediterranean produce, local seafood, and artisanal goods, creating an authentic Spanish shopping experience. For upscale boutique shopping and gourmet dining, Jávea's exclusive retailers are a 20-minute drive, while Benidorm's extensive shopping centers provide alternative retail experiences.

transport.text: Transportation connectivity positions Calpe as an accessible Mediterranean destination without sacrificing privacy and quiet. Alicante-Elche Airport, Spain's third-largest facility, lies 60 minutes south with direct flights to the UK, Germany, France, and Scandinavia—essential for international residents. Regional bus connections link Calpe to Benidorm (30 minutes) and Valencia (90 minutes), while the forthcoming tram system will revolutionize local transit connectivity. For residents preferring private transport, Spain's autopistas (motorways) provide straightforward access to all Costa Blanca destinations. The town's compact geography means most amenities are accessible within 10 minutes by car, while the established cycling culture makes alternative transport viable.

The microclimate provides 320 days of annual sunshine, making it ideal for year-round living or extended residency.
